    Continuous Data Table

    Kyle Baron

    2020-06-02

    continuous-table.Rmd

    These functions create summary tables for continuous data. There is a long format and a wide format.

    Long format

    library(pmtables)
library(dplyr)

id <- pmtables:::data("id")

    A summary of covariates

    pt_cont_long(id, cols = "WT,ALB,SCR")
    Variable Mean Median SD1 Min / Max
    All data (n=160)
    WT 70.9 70.2 12.9 43.6 / 97.2
    ALB 4.19 4.31 0.809 1.28 / 5.39
    SCR 1.36 1.04 0.986 0.710 / 5.59

    1 standard deviation

    Paneled summary

    Use the panel argument to split this by, for example, study

    pt_cont_long(
  id,
  cols = "WT,ALB,SCR",
  panel = vars(Study = STUDYf)
)
    Variable Mean Median SD1 Min / Max
    Study 12-DEMO-001 (n=30)
    WT 72.9 71.0 14.6 50.9 / 97.2
    ALB 4.27 4.08 0.469 3.56 / 5.15
    SCR 1.03 1.04 0.155 0.740 / 1.30
    Study 12-DEMO-002 (n=50)
    WT 72.4 72.2 11.4 51.5 / 96.6
    ALB 4.47 4.43 0.468 3.65 / 5.39
    SCR 0.971 0.970 0.161 0.720 / 1.30
    Study 11-DEMO-005 (n=40)
    WT 69.2 65.8 14.4 43.6 / 92.8
    ALB 4.42 4.44 0.536 3.51 / 5.39
    SCR 2.52 2.33 1.43 0.720 / 5.59
    Study 13-DEMO-001 (n=40)
    WT 69.4 68.1 11.6 50.7 / 96.6
    ALB 3.53 3.46 1.15 1.28 / 5.38
    SCR 0.950 0.975 0.165 0.710 / 1.26
    All data (n=160)
    WT 70.9 70.2 12.9 43.6 / 97.2
    ALB 4.19 4.31 0.809 1.28 / 5.39
    SCR 1.36 1.04 0.986 0.710 / 5.59

    1 standard deviation

    Wide format

    There is also a wide format, where variable names go across the table.

    pt_cont_wide(id, cols = "WT,ALB,SCR")
    n WT ALB SCR
    160 70.9 (12.9) 4.19 (0.809) 1.36 (0.986)
    summary is: mean (standard deviation)

    We can use the by argument here

    pt_cont_wide(id,cols="WT,ALB,SCR",by = vars(Study = STUDYf))
    Study n WT ALB SCR
    12-DEMO-001 30 72.9 (14.6) 4.27 (0.469) 1.03 (0.155)
    12-DEMO-002 50 72.4 (11.4) 4.47 (0.468) 0.971 (0.161)
    11-DEMO-005 40 69.2 (14.4) 4.42 (0.536) 2.52 (1.43)
    13-DEMO-001 40 69.4 (11.6) 3.53 (1.15) 0.950 (0.165)
    All data 160 70.9 (12.9) 4.19 (0.809) 1.36 (0.986)
    summary is: mean (standard deviation)

    Or use by and panel

    pt_cont_wide(
  id,
  cols=vars(WT,ALB,SCR),
  by = vars(Study = STUDYf),
  panel=vars(Sex = SEXf)
)
    Study n WT ALB SCR
    Sex: male
    12-DEMO-001 10 76.3 (16.8) 4.33 (0.468) 1.09 (0.174)
    12-DEMO-002 18 72.0 (13.0) 4.57 (0.497) 1.01 (0.182)
    11-DEMO-005 29 69.2 (15.0) 4.46 (0.543) 2.51 (1.46)
    13-DEMO-001 23 71.1 (13.3) 3.65 (0.993) 0.922 (0.163)
    Sex: female
    12-DEMO-001 20 71.2 (13.6) 4.24 (0.478) 1.01 (0.141)
    12-DEMO-002 32 72.6 (10.6) 4.42 (0.450) 0.949 (0.146)
    11-DEMO-005 11 69.1 (13.3) 4.32 (0.524) 2.53 (1.43)
    13-DEMO-001 17 67.0 (8.74) 3.36 (1.36) 0.988 (0.164)
    Total
    All data 160 70.9 (12.9) 4.19 (0.809) 1.36 (0.986)
    summary is: mean (standard deviation)
